method.description: The method to use to determine the docstring style.
method.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

The method to use to determine the docstring style.
method.title: method

style_order.description: The order of the docstring styles to try.
style_order.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

The order of the docstring styles to try.
style_order.title: style_order

default.title: default
default.description: The default docstring style to use if no other style is detected.
default.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

The default docstring style to use if no other style is detected.

ignore_init_summary.description: Whether to ignore the summary in `__init__` methods' docstrings.
ignore_init_summary.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Whether to ignore the summary in `__init__` methods' docstrings.
ignore_init_summary.title: ignore_init_summary

returns_multiple_items.description:
Whether to parse multiple items in `Yields` and `Returns` sections.

When true, each item's continuation lines must be indented.
When false (single item), no further indentation is required.
returns_multiple_items.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Whether to parse multiple items in `Yields` and `Returns` sections.

When true, each item's continuation lines must be indented.
When false (single item), no further indentation is required.
returns_multiple_items.title: returns_multiple_items

returns_named_value.description:
Whether to parse `Yields` and `Returns` section items as name and description, rather than type and description.

When true, type must be wrapped in parentheses: `(int): Description.`. Names are optional: `name (int): Description.`.
When false, parentheses are optional but the items cannot be named: `int: Description`.
returns_named_value.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Whether to parse `Yields` and `Returns` section items as name and description, rather than type and description.

When true, type must be wrapped in parentheses: `(int): Description.`. Names are optional: `name (int): Description.`.
When false, parentheses are optional but the items cannot be named: `int: Description`.
returns_named_value.title: returns_named_value

returns_type_in_property_summary.description: Whether to parse the return type of properties at the beginning of their summary: `str: Summary of the property`.
returns_type_in_property_summary.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Whether to parse the return type of properties at the beginning of their summary: `str: Summary of the property`.
returns_type_in_property_summary.title: returns_type_in_property_summary

receives_multiple_items.description:
Whether to parse multiple items in `Receives` sections.

When true, each item's continuation lines must be indented.
When false (single item), no further indentation is required.
receives_multiple_items.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Whether to parse multiple items in `Receives` sections.

When true, each item's continuation lines must be indented.
When false (single item), no further indentation is required.
receives_multiple_items.title: receives_multiple_items

receives_named_value.description:
Whether to parse `Receives` section items as name and description, rather than type and description.

When true, type must be wrapped in parentheses: `(int): Description.`. Names are optional: `name (int): Description.`.
When false, parentheses are optional but the items cannot be named: `int: Description`.
receives_named_value.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Whether to parse `Receives` section items as name and description, rather than type and description.

When true, type must be wrapped in parentheses: `(int): Description.`. Names are optional: `name (int): Description.`.
When false, parentheses are optional but the items cannot be named: `int: Description`.
receives_named_value.title: receives_named_value

trim_doctest_flags.description: Whether to remove doctest flags from Python example blocks.
trim_doctest_flags.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Whether to remove doctest flags from Python example blocks.
trim_doctest_flags.title: trim_doctest_flags

warn_unknown_params.description: Warn about documented parameters not appearing in the signature.
warn_unknown_params.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

Warn about documented parameters not appearing in the signature.
warn_unknown_params.title: warn_unknown_params

domains.description: The domains to load from the inventory.

The domains to load from the inventory.

Whether to remove doctest flags from Python example blocks.

Warn about documented parameters not appearing in the signature.

paths.description: The paths in which to search for Python packages.
paths.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/#paths)

The paths in which to search for Python packages.
paths.title: paths

load_external_modules.description: Whether to always load external modules/packages.
load_external_modules.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/#load_external_modules)

Whether to always load external modules/packages.
load_external_modules.title: load_external_modules

options.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/#options)

Configuration options for collecting and rendering objects.
options.title: options

locale.description: The locale to use when translating template strings.
locale.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/#locale)

The locale to use when translating template strings.
locale.title: locale

allow_inspection.description: Whether to allow inspecting modules when visiting them is not possible.
allow_inspection.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/general/#allow_inspection)

Whether to allow inspecting modules when visiting them is not possible.
allow_inspection.title: allow_inspection

force_inspection.description: Whether to force using dynamic analysis when loading data.
force_inspection.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/general/#force_inspection)

Whether to force using dynamic analysis when loading data.
force_inspection.title: force_inspection

annotations_path.description: The verbosity for annotations path: `brief` (recommended), `source` (as written in the source), or `full`.
annotations_path.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/signatures/#annotations_path)

The verbosity for annotations path: `brief` (recommended), `source` (as written in the source), or `full`.
annotations_path.title: annotations_path

backlinks.description: Whether to render backlinks, and how.
backlinks.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/general/#backlinks)

Whether to render backlinks, and how.
backlinks.title: backlinks

docstring_options.description:
The options for the docstring parser.

See [docstring parsers](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/griffe/reference/docstrings/) and their options in Griffe docs.
docstring_options.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_options)

The options for the docstring parser.

See [docstring parsers](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/griffe/reference/docstrings/) and their options in Griffe docs.
docstring_options.title: docstring_options

docstring_section_style.description: The style used to render docstring sections.
docstring_section_style.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_section_style)

The style used to render docstring sections.
docstring_section_style.title: docstring_section_style

docstring_style.description: The docstring style to use: `auto`, `google`, `numpy`, `sphinx`, or `None`.
docstring_style.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#docstring_style)

The docstring style to use: `auto`, `google`, `numpy`, `sphinx`, or `None`.
docstring_style.title: docstring_style

extensions.description: A list of Griffe extensions to load.
extensions.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/general/#extensions)

A list of Griffe extensions to load.
extensions.title: extensions

filters.description:
A list of filters applied to filter objects based on their name.

A filter starting with `!` will exclude matching objects instead of including them.
The `members` option takes precedence over `filters` (filters will still be applied recursively
to lower members in the hierarchy).
filters.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/members/#filters)

A list of filters applied to filter objects based on their name.

A filter starting with `!` will exclude matching objects instead of including them.
The `members` option takes precedence over `filters` (filters will still be applied recursively
to lower members in the hierarchy).
filters.title: filters

find_stubs_package.description: Whether to load stubs package (package-stubs) when extracting docstrings.
find_stubs_package.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/general/#find_stubs_package)

Whether to load stubs package (package-stubs) when extracting docstrings.
find_stubs_package.title: find_stubs_package

group_by_category.description: Group the object's children by categories: attributes, classes, functions, and modules.
group_by_category.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/members/#group_by_category)

Group the object's children by categories: attributes, classes, functions, and modules.
group_by_category.title: group_by_category

heading.description: A custom string to override the autogenerated heading of the root object.
heading.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/headings/#heading)

A custom string to override the autogenerated heading of the root object.
heading.title: heading

heading_level.description: The initial heading level to use.
heading_level.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/headings/#heading_level)

The initial heading level to use.
heading_level.title: heading_level

inherited_members.description:
A boolean, or an explicit list of inherited members to render.

If true, select all inherited members, which can then be filtered with `members`.
If false or empty list, do not select any inherited member.
inherited_members.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/members/#inherited_members)

A boolean, or an explicit list of inherited members to render.

If true, select all inherited members, which can then be filtered with `members`.
If false or empty list, do not select any inherited member.
inherited_members.title: inherited_members

line_length.description: Maximum line length when formatting code/signatures.
line_length.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/signatures/#line_length)

Maximum line length when formatting code/signatures.
line_length.title: line_length

members.description:
A boolean, or an explicit list of members to render.

If true, select all members without further filtering.
If false or empty list, do not render members.
If none, select all members and apply further filtering with filters and docstrings.
members.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/members/#members)

A boolean, or an explicit list of members to render.

If true, select all members without further filtering.
If false or empty list, do not render members.
If none, select all members and apply further filtering with filters and docstrings.
members.title: members

members_order.description:
The members ordering to use.

- `alphabetical`: order by the members names,
- `source`: order members as they appear in the source file.
members_order.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/members/#members_order)

The members ordering to use.

- `alphabetical`: order by the members names,
- `source`: order members as they appear in the source file.
members_order.title: members_order

merge_init_into_class.description: Whether to merge the `__init__` method into the class' signature and docstring.
merge_init_into_class.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#merge_init_into_class)

Whether to merge the `__init__` method into the class' signature and docstring.
merge_init_into_class.title: merge_init_into_class

modernize_annotations.description: Whether to modernize annotations, for example `Optional[str]` into `str | None`.
modernize_annotations.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/signatures/#modernize_annotations)

Whether to modernize annotations, for example `Optional[str]` into `str | None`.
modernize_annotations.title: modernize_annotations

parameter_headings.description: Whether to render headings for parameters (therefore showing parameters in the ToC).
parameter_headings.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/headings/#parameter_headings)

Whether to render headings for parameters (therefore showing parameters in the ToC).
parameter_headings.title: parameter_headings

preload_modules.description:
Pre-load modules that are not specified directly in autodoc instructions (`::: identifier`).

It is useful when you want to render documentation for a particular member of an object,
and this member is imported from another package than its parent.

For an imported member to be rendered, you need to add it to the `__all__` attribute
of the importing module.

The modules must be listed as an array of strings.
preload_modules.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/general/#preload_modules)

Pre-load modules that are not specified directly in autodoc instructions (`::: identifier`).

It is useful when you want to render documentation for a particular member of an object,
and this member is imported from another package than its parent.

For an imported member to be rendered, you need to add it to the `__all__` attribute
of the importing module.

The modules must be listed as an array of strings.
preload_modules.title: preload_modules

relative_crossrefs.description: Whether to enable the relative crossref syntax.
relative_crossrefs.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#relative_crossrefs)

Whether to enable the relative crossref syntax.
relative_crossrefs.title: relative_crossrefs

scoped_crossrefs.description: Whether to enable the scoped crossref ability.
scoped_crossrefs.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/docstrings/#scoped_crossrefs)

Whether to enable the scoped crossref ability.
scoped_crossrefs.title: scoped_crossrefs

show_overloads.description: Show the overloads of a function or method.
show_overloads.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/signatures/#show_overloads)

Show the overloads of a function or method.
show_overloads.title: show_overloads

separate_signature.description:
Whether to put the whole signature in a code block below the heading.

If Black or Ruff are installed, the signature is also formatted using them.
separate_signature.markdownDescription:

Show the heading of the object at the root of the documentation tree.

Show the full Python path of the root members.

show_symbol_type_heading.markdownDescription:

show_symbol_type_toc.title: show_symbol_type_toc

signature_crossrefs.description: Whether to render cross-references for type annotations in signatures.
signature_crossrefs.markdownDescription:
[DOCUMENTATION](https://mkdocstrings.github.io/python/usage/configuration/signatures/#signature_crossrefs)

summary.markdownDescription:

Whether to render summaries of modules, classes, functions (methods) and attributes.

toc_label.description: A custom string to override the autogenerated toc label of the root object.
toc_label.markdownDescription:
